title: Print Hello Kitty's Face
description: Write a program that prints an ASCII art of Hello Kitty's face.
hints: Each line should be printed separately
solution: public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("                     .-."); System.out.println("          .-._    _.../   `,    _.-."); System.out.println("          |   `'-'    \     \_'`   |"); System.out.println("          \            '.__,/ `\_.--,"); System.out.println("           /                '._/     |"); System.out.println("          /                    '.    /"); System.out.println("         ;   _                  _'--;"); System.out.println("      '--|- (_)       __       (_) -|--'"); System.out.println("      .--|-          (__)          -|--."); System.out.println("       .-\-                        -/-."); System.out.println("      '   '.                      .'   `"); System.out.println("            '-._              _.-'"); System.out.println("                `""--....--""`"); } }

title: Hello Kitty's Name
description: Store 'Hello Kitty' in a variable and print it.
solution: public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { String name = "Hello Kitty"; System.out.println(name); } }

title: Kitty's Age in Cat Years
description: Write a program that takes Hello Kitty's age as input and converts it to cat years (multiply by 7).
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); int age = sc.nextInt(); System.out.println(age * 7); } }

title: Kitty's Favorite Food
description: Ask the user for Hello Kitty's favorite food and print it.
hints: Store input in a String variable
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); String food = sc.nextLine(); System.out.println("Hello Kitty loves " + food + "!"); } }

title: Kitty's Bow Color
description: Write a program that asks the user for Hello Kitty's bow color and prints it in uppercase.
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); String color = sc.nextLine(); System.out.println(color.toUpperCase()); } }

title: Kitty's Friendship Check
description: Write a program that checks if a name entered by the user is Hello Kitty's best friend, 'Mimi'.
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); String name = sc.nextLine(); if (name.equalsIgnoreCase("Mimi")) { System.out.println("Best friends forever!"); } else { System.out.println("Let's be friends!"); } } }

title: Kitty's Age Comparison
description: Write a program that asks for an age and checks if it is older or younger than Hello Kitty (48 years old).
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); int age = sc.nextInt(); if (age > 48) { System.out.println("You're older than Hello Kitty!"); } else { System.out.println("You're younger than Hello Kitty!"); } } }

title: Random Hello Kitty Fact
description: Write a program that randomly selects and prints one fun fact about Hello Kitty.
hints: Use Math.random() to generate a random number
Use an array or if statements for different facts
solution: import java.util.Random; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { String[] facts = {"Hello Kitty was created in 1974.", "She has a twin sister named Mimi.", "Hello Kitty's real name is Kitty White.", "She is not a cat, but a little girl!"}; Random rand = new Random(); System.out.println(facts[rand.nextInt(facts.length)]); } }

testCases.output: One of the Hello Kitty facts

title: Kitty's Jump Calculation
description: Write a method that calculates how high Hello Kitty can jump based on her weight and energy level.
hints: Create a method that returns a value
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static double jumpHeight(double weight, double energy) { return Math.sqrt(energy) / weight; } public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); double weight = sc.nextDouble(); double energy = sc.nextDouble(); System.out.println(jumpHeight(weight, energy)); } }

title: Kitty's Lucky Number
description: Write a program that asks the user for a number and checks if it matches Hello Kitty's lucky number (7).
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); int num = sc.nextInt(); if (num == 7) { System.out.println("You guessed Hello Kitty's lucky number!"); } else { System.out.println("Try again!"); } } }

testCases.output: You guessed Hello Kitty's lucky number!
